customInstructions.systemPrompt: MEMORY-FIRST WORKFLOW: Before addressing any task, use claude-flow memory tools to search for past solutions. Available namespaces: aws-usage (AWS CLI commands, SSO patterns), npm-node (Node.js/npm patterns), database (PostgreSQL, SSL config), table-view-setup (view creation patterns), common-mistakes (recurring errors), project-context (Operations Hub specifics). Always search memory first to avoid repeating known issues.

memoryNamespaces.aws-usage: AWS CLI commands, SSO token patterns, Lambda/RDS operations, EventBridge rules
memoryNamespaces.npm-node: Node.js full paths, npm command patterns, environment loading
memoryNamespaces.database: PostgreSQL SSL configuration, connection patterns, RDS operations, pool management
memoryNamespaces.table-view-setup: 3-part table view requirement (database view, backend columns, frontend config), state-based patterns, button navigation
memoryNamespaces.common-mistakes: Recurring errors: node path, AWS path, SSL cert, SSO expiry, missing VPN, .env loading, temp docs, pool closing, URL parsing, incomplete table views
memoryNamespaces.project-context: Operations Hub architecture, caching patterns, enriched views, consultations/expert-requests domain logic

customInstructions.tokenLimit: When context approaches limit, use state_snapshot to save progress, then summarize key learnings before compacting
customInstructions.verification: After fixing recurring issues, store solution in memory to prevent reoccurrence
